name: stabones
text: A comment left by stabones was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rolotonybrowntown, Jesler729, Picnick, milkpants, scraggg)

name: senor_diablo
text: I concur!!

name: the_doz
text:
Encyclopedia of The Great Outdoor Fight

This link is buried in the comments of one of the strips in the arc, but I felt it merited a position of greater reverence. You have to see it to believe it.

name: sandswipe
text:
. . . wow.

What? Wow.

name: charchar
text: Your avatar speaks!

name: thequietyou
text: Chubby for the link

name: all-star951
text: The link doesn't seem work

name: poodlelucy
text: this arc is so hot i can barely stop reading to rate it.

name: hexjumper
text: The look on Fancy Mark Clacny's face is amazing.

name: juancarlos
text: Well, No one said it could be done.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Which, now that I think about it, is not the same as everyone saying it couldn't be done.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, shakey, amandulence)

name: slab64
text:
Yeah, a dude thats on the receiving end of a pilsner lobotomy is pretty much unimpressed with any cancers that he might have.

So I guess you could call that a cure.

name: thesyndicate88
text: Chubbied simply for 'Pilsner Lobotomy'

name: slab64
text:
You know, sometimes you type something and you just know it's going to get Chubbied.

This was one of those.

name: soticoto
text:
Heh... Chubbed that and the other one.
Had a few moments like that myself... though I always get an assortment of Lames too... like Asherdan-Lite.

Funnily enough, my favourite ever comment that I personally made didn't get anywhere near my max chubbs... but then my execution wasn't perfect.

(In case anyone cares, it was when Philippe hit the deer on the road and I remarked "Here comes a special van" ... I was always proud of myself for that, for some reason.)

name: blitztrug
text: no one cares

name: mrslickster
text:
I think you are canadian. I am canadian.
I think you like pilsner. I like pilsner.
I give you a chubby now.

name: i_love_kate
text: I hope you are not assuming that Pilsner is in any way a Canadian beverage. I wait for some clarification before I decide to issue my rating of your comment.

name: slab64
text: Whoa, whoa. Soooo not Canadian.

name: slodowy_slicer
text: I like the brain morsel clinging to the bottle upon exit.

name: all-star951
text: You have a disturbed mind.

name: contrasoma
text: "Dang, I never thought it would be like this! A guy is tearing off my middle!"

name: soticoto
text: Now if it could be done to TOM Clancy... that would impress me.

name: hollis
text: I love this story arc too... I also love the fact that in Roast Beef's mind, "is" gets represented by "=="

name: delzhand
text: A comment left by delzhand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sakana, twohundredninety, craigola, Magb, ubersplat)

name: zem
text:
1. no. they are actually the same object, just with different names. they do not just share the same characteristics

2. oh god who cares

name: nice-on-merlot
text:
Stubbs - Smuckles == 0.
Hell yes pointer arthmetic.

name: nice-on-merlot
text: I am so so sorry

name: jamers
text: Stubbs.compareTo(Smuckles) == 0

name: anewcede
text: This completely makes the comic for me.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Scientists are still figuring it out.

name: craigola
text: Ray's lucky to have a friend like Beef, and vice versa.

name: malesherbez
text:
I remember that this was not how I pictured the fight at all
so when this strip hit I was shocked

name: malesherbez
text: plus I use sass in the main in normal conversation even today

name: bookofsand
text: Beef's "dumbest workplace sentence" quip reminds me of the worst conversations being had in the English Language . Even though at this point that's still in The Future.

name: deusoma
text: Yeah, the fact that this strip directly leads into the Fight sort of overshadows it, but that's a great line.

name: wehavemagnums
text:
...perfect spiral

Brilliant.

name: epicurus
text: So many great things about this one. "No one said it could be done." AND "Oh, necessarily."

name: straw
text: Seriously, I am going to start saying "necessarily" in all instances where otherwise I would give a very emphatic "yes."

name: paco
text: The idea of throwing a beer bottle straight through someone's head deserves a 5.

name: wae
text:
only onstad would say "no one said it could be done" instead of "they said it couldn't be done"

and that is The Genius of Onstad.

name: mattfish
text: Nobody said it could be done because nobody ever thought of tearing his middle off

name: aaron_haynes
text: Hahaha, damn, wish I'd caught this before my earlier comment.

name: epicurus
text: Yes, so exactly right.

name: estutius
text: Why is Fancy Mark Clancy wearing Ray's medallion?

name: thegrapist
text:
holy shit I never noticed that.
Maybe that's how it got passed down the Smuckles family
This medallion is interestin'.

name: droplede
text: good eye, man. didn't catch it at first.

name: myrrdisparo
text: Is it me or is it just a tad smaller than Ray's medallion?

name: jerkface
text: Onstad is the Thomas Edison of names. I can't not smile when I just think 'Fancy Mark Clancy'. Poetry!

name: johnmatrix
text: Nah. The Thomas Edisons of names are the Chapman brothers. Onstad comes up with a good one every now and then though. I'm partial to Ultra Peanut myself.

name: cailetshadow
text: Actually, he's more like the Lonis Edison of names.

name: anzio
text: Actually, he is both the Thomas Edison and Nikola Tesla of names, because unlike Edison, he doesn't just steal all his good ideas from an Eastern European.

name: cailetshadow
text: Just because Edison was a thief and a total jackass doesn't mean he wasn't also brilliant and an extremely important inventor in his own right. But conversely, just because he was an extremely important inventor in his own right doesn't mean he wasn't also a thief and a jackass.

name: unquotable
text: Oh necessarily

name: pogo
text: Or in Spanish, "o necessito"

name: cailetshadow
text:
the alt text to this made me laugh so hard that I made a sound which startled a passing bat.

DQ? Died Quietly? A beer bottle erupted from the side of his screaming head! Ain't no way that was an open-casket funeral.

name: eatmorekix
text: disqualified

name: cailetshadow
text:
You're right. A google search for what I though it meant yeilds 0 results and a suggested misspelling of my name.

pwned.

name: morypcaina
text:
So 2999 people were disqualified from the great outdoor fight on account of death? Damn.

*has not read the rest of the arc yet*

name: solle
text:
It took me nearly a year to realize Beef is talking in H2G2-speak here.

Awesome.

name: beansdooma
text: I'm willing to bet that 127 strips before this, Ray said something really stupid.

name: scraggg
text:
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuacLTsDS

Now, I just determined this by counting backwards, but I'm pretty confident it's correct.

name: firesign
text: Beef said 127 days , not 127 strips . 127 Days previous would be September 29th, 2005 . Apparently our last dumbest workplace sentence is "Chinga Jaime!"

name: baryonyx
text: Ever since 1973 there has been a small panel of scientists that convenes daily to try and determine the logistics behind when Rodney Leonard Stubbs threw a beer bottle through Carl Veldt's head. They have yet to resolve the issue.

name: boopy
text: such an epic beginning.

name: invidious
text: Roast Beef's lines in this strip are nothing but pure gold.  The "Dumbest sentence" and "Thomas Edison" quips are two of the most memorable I've read on Achewood.

name: agentstinky
text: It saddens me greatly that I have never had opportunity to use "Necessarily" in such a fashion.

name: rad-chillies
text: apparently the glasses are hereditary

name: mustakrakesh
text: Ain't give no sucker your meal, it adds to nothin' and he is an animal all the while, no receipt on file, no loyalty no style

name: nyl
text:
Wow, poor Fancy Mark Clancy.........
Coolest name ever, though.

name: jabroniville
text: I think my favourite thing about this whole arc is that EVERYONE seems ultra-familiar with the Great Outdoor Fight and everything to do with it, despite the fact that it has never been brought up until right now.

name: stonecrab
text: My very own personal hardback copy of TGOF just arrived yesterday! Soooo excited -- if I was male, I bet I would have my own personal chubby, too.

name: dasilodavi
text:
Sass in the main. Hmm.

Now, is that like saying it's mainly sass," like "in the main" is the same as "for real?" Or is the main like the metaphorical pipeline of information in the rumor circle? I can't really figure it out.

name: genequagmire
text: This is the one that got me into the strip, via the autographed (weird) copy that my local library has.

name: dans
text: Your local library carries Achewood? That is rad as hell!

name: lizard
text: God, agreed.  And yes, weird.

name: doublebatman
text: I love how Beef thinks in computer code.

name: brailleteeth
text: I love how quickly Roast Beef pieces everything together CSI style.
